name: getReportsId
description: Get report details for a specific sent campaign.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

campaign_id.description: The unique id for the campaign.

$block: Report details about a sent campaign.

$ul: **_links**: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.
**ab_split**: General stats about different groups of an A/B Split campaign. Does not return information about Multivariate Campaigns.
**a**: Stats for Campaign A.
**abuse_reports**: Abuse reports for Campaign A.
**bounces**: Bounces for Campaign A.
**forwards**: Forwards for Campaign A.
**forwards_opens**: Opens from forwards for Campaign A.
**last_open**: The last open for Campaign A.
**opens**: Opens for Campaign A.
**recipient_clicks**: Recipient Clicks for Campaign A.
**unique_opens**: Unique opens for Campaign A.
**unsubs**: Unsubscribes for Campaign A.
**b**: Stats for Campaign B.
**abuse_reports**: Abuse reports for Campaign B.
**bounces**: Bounces for Campaign B.
**forwards**: Forwards for Campaign B.
**forwards_opens**: Opens for forwards from Campaign B.
**last_open**: The last open for Campaign B.
**opens**: Opens for Campaign B.
**recipient_clicks**: Recipients clicks for Campaign B.
**unique_opens**: Unique opens for Campaign B.
**unsubs**: Unsubscribes for Campaign B.
**abuse_reports**: The number of abuse reports generated for this campaign.
**bounces**: An object describing the bounce summary for the campaign.
**hard_bounces**: The total number of hard bounced email addresses.
**soft_bounces**: The total number of soft bounced email addresses.
**syntax_errors**: The total number of addresses that were syntax-related bounces.
**campaign_title**: The title of the campaign.
**clicks**: An object describing the click activity for the campaign.
**click_rate**: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.
**clicks_total**: The total number of clicks for the campaign.
**last_click**: The date and time of the last recorded click for the campaign in ISO 8601 format.
**unique_clicks**: The total number of unique clicks for links across a campaign.
**unique_subscriber_clicks**: The total number of subscribers who clicked on a campaign.
**delivery_status**: Updates on campaigns in the process of sending.
**can_cancel**: Whether a campaign send can be canceled.
**emails_canceled**: The total number of emails canceled for this campaign.
**emails_sent**: The total number of emails confirmed sent for this campaign so far.
**enabled**: Whether Campaign Delivery Status is enabled for this account and campaign.
**status**: The current state of a campaign delivery.
**ecommerce**: E-Commerce stats for a campaign.
**currency_code**
**total_orders**: The total orders for a campaign.
**total_revenue**: The total revenue for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals minus shipping and tax totals.
**total_spent**: The total spent for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals with no deductions.
**emails_sent**: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.
**facebook_likes**: An object describing campaign engagement on Facebook.
**facebook_likes**: The number of Facebook likes for the campaign.
**recipient_likes**: The number of recipients who liked the campaign on Facebook.
**unique_likes**: The number of unique likes.
**forwards**: An object describing the forwards and forward activity for the campaign.
**forwards_count**: How many times the campaign has been forwarded.
**forwards_opens**: How many times the forwarded campaign has been opened.
**id**: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.
**industry_stats**: The average campaign statistics for your industry.
**abuse_rate**: The industry abuse rate.
**bounce_rate**: The industry bounce rate.
**click_rate**: The industry click rate.
**open_rate**: The industry open rate.
**type**: The type of business industry associated with your account. For example: retail, education, etc.
**unopen_rate**: The industry unopened rate.
**unsub_rate**: The industry unsubscribe rate.
**list_id**: The unique list id.
**list_is_active**: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.
**list_name**: The name of the list.
**list_stats**: The average campaign statistics for your list. This won't be present if we haven't calculated it yet for this list.
**click_rate**: The average click rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list.
**open_rate**: The average open rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list.
**sub_rate**: The average number of subscriptions per month for the list.
**unsub_rate**: The average number of unsubscriptions per month for the list.
**opens**: An object describing the open activity for the campaign.
**last_open**: The date and time of the last recorded open in ISO 8601 format.
**open_rate**: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.
**opens_total**: The total number of opens for a campaign.
**unique_opens**: The total number of unique opens.
**preview_text**: The preview text for the campaign.
**rss_last_send**: For RSS campaigns, the date and time of the last send in ISO 8601 format.
**send_time**: The date and time a campaign was sent in ISO 8601 format.
**share_report**: The url and password for the [VIP report](https://mailchimp.com/help/share-a-campaign-report/).
**share_password**: If password protected, the password for the VIP report.
**share_url**: The URL for the VIP report.
**subject_line**: The subject line for the campaign.
**timeseries**: An hourly breakdown of the performance of the campaign over the first 24 hours.
**timewarp**: An hourly breakdown of sends, opens, and clicks if a campaign is sent using timewarp.
**type**: The type of campaign (regular, plain-text, ab_split, rss, automation, variate, or auto).
**unsubscribed**: The total number of unsubscribed members for this campaign.

$block: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

$ul: **detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
**instance**: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.
**status**: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**type**: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.
